column4: Can someone perhaps help me with Skype? I can't seem to close it or change status.
open a terminal and type in the command "killall skype"
Doesn't work. I have to shut it down via the system monitor.
I was just wondering if it was a common problem with a common solution.
I doubt skype is being started as root
I have to delete the configuration folder each time I start it, basically.
are you running the latest version of skype on i386 (32-bit)
I just downloaded it from the main site. Are there any other version?
It's like it doesn't interact with the rest of the system.
you are running ubuntu 32-bit or 64-bit? which version of ubuntu are you running?
same here and skype works fine for me
if it ever locks up "killall skype" usually works at closing it
when you say it "doesn't work" wjat error do you get when you run that command?
It seems incredibly slow as well. Could it be that the qt-stuff isn't working right?
perhaps, are you runing gnome or kde?
what error do you get when you type "killall skype"?
